newsitem.title: USA: Century buys stake in Wireless 2000.
newsitem.headline: Century buys stake in Wireless 2000.

text.p: Century Telephone Enterprises Inc said Thursday it has acquired a 19.5 percent interest in Wireless 2000 Inc for an undisclosed amount.
As part of the pact, the company said it has conditional rights to buy additional ownership in Wireless 2000.
Century also agreed to build and operate Personal Communications Services (PCS) networks for Wireless 2000 in the Alexandria, Monroe and Lake Charles, La., areas.
Century said it expects to begin limited PCS services in the fourth quarter of 1997.
Wireless 2000, a private company, based in Marksville, La., won 30MHz of spectrum in each of these markets in the U.S. Federal Communications Commission "C Block" auction licenses.
